column2: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030
column5: The reduction of antimicrobials in farmed animals can lead to a decrease in the development of antimicrobial-resistant bacteria, which can positively impact the environment and human health, aligning with the goals of reducing pollution and promoting sustainable practices in the EU.

column2: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector
column5: Fostering the competitiveness of the EU supply sector can lead to increased innovation and investment in sustainable technologies, such as those related to textile production, which can contribute to a more circular economy and reduced waste.

column2: Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas
column5: Ensuring access to fast broadband can facilitate the adoption of digital technologies in agriculture, such as precision farming, which can lead to more efficient use of resources, reduced waste, and improved sustainability, aligning with the goals of a circular economy.

column2: Create shorter supply chains
column5: Shorter supply chains can lead to reduced transportation emissions and waste, which can positively impact the environment and contribute to a more circular economy.

column2: Create new job opportunities
column5: Creating new job opportunities in sustainable sectors, such as those related to waste management and recycling, can contribute to a more circular economy and reduced unemployment.

column2: Ensure Fair, inclusive and ethical value chains
column5: Ensuring fair and ethical value chains can lead to improved working conditions, reduced exploitation, and increased transparency, which can positively impact the environment and human health, aligning with the goals of a circular economy.

column2: Promote better animal welfare
column5: Promoting better animal welfare can lead to improved living conditions, reduced stress, and increased efficiency in animal farming, which can contribute to a more sustainable food system and reduced environmental impact.

column2: Strengthen educational messages
column5: Strengthening educational messages on sustainable food production and consumption can lead to increased awareness and adoption of sustainable practices, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Provide food information and labelling
column5: Providing clear food information and labelling can facilitate informed consumer choices, promote sustainable food production, and reduce waste, aligning with the goals of a circular economy.

column2: Extend the mandatory origin or provenance indications
column5: Extending mandatory origin or provenance indications can increase transparency, promote local production, and reduce transportation emissions, which can positively impact the environment and contribute to a more circular economy.

column2: Improve availability of sustainable food
column5: Improving availability of sustainable food can lead to increased consumption of sustainable products, reduced waste, and improved environmental impact, aligning with the goals of a circular economy.

column2: Reduce nutrient losses
column5: Reducing nutrient losses can lead to improved soil health, increased efficiency in fertilizer use, and reduced environmental pollution, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Ensure affordability and access to sufficient, nutritious and sustainable food
column5: Ensuring access to sufficient, nutritious, and sustainable food can lead to improved human health, reduced poverty, and increased food security, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Increase reformulation of food products
column5: Increasing reformulation of food products can lead to reduced waste, improved nutrition, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Ensure all access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food
column5: Ensuring access to quality, safe, sustainable, and nutritious food can lead to improved human health, reduced poverty, and increased food security, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Move to healthier and more sustainable diets
column5: Moving to healthier and more sustainable diets can lead to reduced environmental impact, improved human health, and increased food security, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Reverse prevalence of overweight and diet-related diseases
column5: Reversing the prevalence of overweight and diet-related diseases can lead to improved human health, reduced healthcare costs, and increased productivity, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Strengthen the resilience of the EU food system
column5: Strengthening the resilience of the EU food system can lead to improved food security, reduced waste, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA5.36, so there is no connection to be made.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA5.37, so there is no connection to be made.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
column5: Reducing the use of more hazardous pesticides can lead to improved environmental health, increased biodiversity, and reduced pollution, which can positively impact ecosystem services.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides
column5: Reducing the use and risk of chemical pesticides can lead to improved environmental health, increased biodiversity, and reduced pollution, which can positively impact ecosystem services.

column2: Increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture
column5: Increasing sustainable fishing and aquaculture can lead to improved marine biodiversity, reduced overfishing, and increased food security, which can positively impact ecosystem services.

column2: Tackle climate change
column5: Tackling climate change can lead to reduced greenhouse gas emissions, improved air quality, and increased resilience, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Sustainable use of water
column5: Sustainable use of water can lead to improved water quality, reduced waste, and increased efficiency, which can positively impact biodiversity and ecosystem services.

column2: Increase organic farming
column5: Increasing organic farming can lead to improved soil health, reduced pollution, and increased biodiversity, which can positively impact ecosystem services.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA3.38, so there is no connection to be made.

column2: From 2025, beverage bottles listed in Part F of the Annex which are manufactured from polyethylene terephthalate as the major component (‘PET bottles’) contain at least 25 % recycled plastic
column5: Increasing the use of recycled plastic in beverage bottles can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: By 2030 textile products placed on the EU market are long-lived and recyclable, to a great extent made of recycled fibres, free of hazardous substances and produced in respect of social rights and the environment
column5: Promoting sustainable textile production can lead to reduced waste, improved working conditions, and increased efficiency, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column5: Increasing the separate collection and recycling of plastic bottles can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: From 2019, the minimum collection rate to be achieved annually shall be 65 % of the average weight of EEE placed on the market in the three preceding years in the Member State concerned, or alternatively 85 % of WEEE generated on the territory of that Member State.
column5: Increasing the collection and recycling of electronic waste can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 85% for Category 1 (temperature exchange equipment) or Category 4 (large equipment with any external dimension more than 50 cm)
column5: Increasing the recovery and recycling of electronic waste can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 80% for Category 1 or Category 4
column5: Increasing the preparation for re-use and recycling of electronic waste can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 0% for Category 1 or Category 4
column5: Increasing the recycling of electronic waste can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: By 2025, the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight (60% by 2030, 65% by 2035)
column5: Increasing the preparation for re-use and recycling of municipal waste can lead to reduced waste, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Member States should aim to achieve an indicative Union-wide food waste reduction target of 30 % by 2025 and 50 % by 2030
column5: Reducing food waste can lead to improved food security, reduced waste, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022, bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025
column5: Increasing the separate collection of hazardous waste can lead to reduced pollution, improved recycling rates, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA3.48, so there is no connection to be made.

column2: By 2030 producers will have responsibility for their products along the value chain, including when they become waste
column5: Promoting producer responsibility can lead to improved waste management, increased recycling rates, and reduced pollution, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA3.6, so there is no connection to be made.

column2: nan
column5: There is no target content for TA3.7, so there is no connection to be made.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: Increasing the extraction capacity for critical raw materials can lead to improved resource efficiency, reduced waste, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: Increasing the processing capacity for critical raw materials can lead to improved resource efficiency, reduced waste, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: *The amendments in Dir. 2023/2413 are also intended to support the achievement of the Union’s target of an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
column5: Increasing the production of sustainable biomethane can lead to improved energy security, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: Reducing fuel intensity in fisheries can lead to improved energy efficiency, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: Reducing transportation costs can lead to improved logistics, increased efficiency, and reduced emissions, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: GHG intensity reduction target in the maritime sector
column5: Reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the maritime sector can lead to improved energy efficiency, reduced pollution, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: Increasing the adoption of zero-emission vehicles can lead to reduced greenhouse gas emissions, improved air quality, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: Renewable and low-carbon fuels should represent between 6% and 9% of the international maritime transport fuel mix by 2030 and between 86% and 88% by 2050
column5: Increasing the use of renewable and low-carbon fuels in maritime transport can lead to reduced greenhouse gas emissions, improved energy efficiency, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles, other than special purpose, off-road, and vocational vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019
column5: Reducing CO2 emissions from heavy-duty vehicles can lead to improved energy efficiency, reduced pollution, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: From 1 January 2020, this Regulation sets an EU fleet-wide target of 95 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new passenger cars and an EU fleet-wide target of 147 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new light commercial vehicles registered in the Union
column5: Reducing CO2 emissions from vehicles can lead to improved energy efficiency, reduced pollution, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.

column2: This Regulation will, until 31 December 2024, be complemented by additional measures corresponding to a reduction of 10 g CO2/km as part of the Union's integrated approach
column5: Reducing CO2 emissions from vehicles can lead to improved energy efficiency, reduced pollution, and increased sustainability, which can positively impact the environment and human health.
